comments:
Using the 0411 win32 integration build.

From the Packages view if you copy a non-Java resource that is out-of-sync with 
the file system, when you paste it you'll receive an exception.  From the .log:

<log-entry date="Mon Apr 15 23:20:42 EDT 2002">
  <status
     code="0"
     severity="ERROR"
     message="See details"

       code="966"

      <exception
         message="Problems encountered while copying resources."

If workbench uses force=true, then we should do so as well.

This operation doesn't work in the Navigator either, but they handle the 
exception and present a dialog saying resource out-of-sync.
This is a refactoring issue. Moving to JDT/UI.
*** Bug 14138 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

worksforme in 20020425
correct 'resource out of synch' dialog is presented now
